description: The music video begins with The Weeknd, 27, whose real name is Abel Makkonen Tesfaye, standing alone in a rocky patch before a beautiful woman descends from the stars to join him.
title: The Weeknd dances with woman in I Feel It Coming video
title_page: The Weeknd dances with woman in I Feel It Coming video | Daily Mail Online
text:
The stars have aligned for The Weeknd in his latest music video, I Feel It Coming.
The dreamy video was unveiled on Thursday, and sees the hit-maker slow dance with a mysterious woman beneath the moonlight before his collaborators, Daft Punk, make a rare joint appearance at the end of the video.
The video begins with The Weeknd, 27, whose real name is Abel Makkonen Tesfaye, standing alone in a rocky patch before a woman descends from the stars to join him.
SCROLL DOWN FOR VIDEO
Magical moment: The stars have aligned for The Weeknd and a mystery woman sent from space in his latest music video, I Feel It Coming
The Weeknd could hardly take his eyes and hands off the beauty as they slow danced beneath the stars.
Taking her hand, the singer grooved with the model as she wore a beige crop top, and sparkling choker necklace.
Their romantic moment comes to an end with a bolt of lightning.
A storm comes through, and Abel's friend turns into stone before crumbling right before his eyes.
Eyes only for her: The Weeknd could hardly take his eyes and hands off the beauty as they slow danced beneath the stars
Tender moment: Taking her hand, the singer grooved with the model as she wore a beige crop top, and sparkling choker necklace
Eye to eye: The pair gazed at each other as they shared a moment
Out of this world: The beauty spellbound as she gazed at Abel
Spotlight: The Weeknd danced with his leading lady
The Weeknd is not immune to the forces of nature as he turns into stone as well, bent over on the ground with his hand outstretched.
The end of the music video sees Daft Punk walking through the snow and coming across a glowing patch of violet light beneath the frost.
The pair gaze ominously at each other after wiping the frost clean to further inspect the unusual light.
So close: The pair cuddled close as they shared in a slow dance
Destined for stardom: The pair enjoyed alone time beneath the gorgeous night sky
Hello sunshine! Abel smiled as the mysterious woman materialized in front of his eyes
Trouble in paradise: A storm comes through, and Abel's friend turns into stone before crumbling onto the floor
Set in stone: The mystery woman transformed before his eyes
Abel teased the release of his new music video on Twitter on Thursday.
'I feel it coming tomorrow,' he tweeted.
The video was released ahead of his suggested premiere date however, and amassed hundreds of thousands of views on the day of it's release.
Forces of nature: The Weeknd was not immune from turning into stone as well
Alone time: The video begins with The Weeknd, 27, whose real name is Abel Makkonen Tesfaye, standing alone in a rocky patch
It's a hit: I Feel It Coming is The Weeknd's second collaboration with Daft Punk and is from his latest album, Starboy
Chart-topper: The song is currently ranked number eleven on Billboard's Hot 100
People have identified the model in the music video as Kiko Mizuhara.
I Feel It Coming is The Weeknd's second collaboration with Daft Punk and is from his latest album, Starboy.
The song is currently ranked number eleven on Billboard's Hot 100.
There they are! The end of the music video sees Daft Punk walking through the snow and coming across a glowing patch of violet light beneath the frost
Getting a look: The pair gaze ominously at each other after wiping the frost clean to further inspect the unusual light
